name: UWidget
doc: This is the base class for all wrapped Slate controls that are exposed to UObjects.

Slot: The parent slot of the UWidget.  Allows us to easily inline edit the layout controlling this widget.
FlowDirectionPreference: Allows you to set a new flow direction
AccessibleBehavior: Whether or not the widget is accessible, and how to describe it. If set to custom, additional customization options will appear.
AccessibleSummaryBehavior: How to describe this widget when it's being presented through a summary of a parent widget. If set to custom, additional customization options will appear.
PixelSnapping: If the widget will draw snapped to the nearest pixel.  Improves clarity but might cause visibile stepping in animation
Navigation:
The navigation object for this widget is optionally created if the user has configured custom
navigation rules for this widget in the widget designer.  Those rules determine how navigation transitions
can occur between widgets.
ToolTipWidget: Tooltip widget to show when the user hovers over the widget with the mouse
bIsEnabled: Sets whether this widget can be modified interactively by the user
ToolTipText: Tooltip text to show when the user hovers over the widget with the mouse
RenderTransformPivot:
The render transform pivot controls the location about which transforms are applied.
This value is a normalized coordinate about which things like rotations will occur.
bOverrideAccessibleDefaults: Override all of the default accessibility behavior and text for this widget.
bCanChildrenBeAccessible: Whether or not children of this widget can appear as distinct accessible widgets.
AccessibleText: When AccessibleBehavior is set to Custom, this is the text that will be used to describe the widget.
AccessibleSummaryText: When AccessibleSummaryBehavior is set to Custom, this is the text that will be used to describe the widget.
bIsVolatile:
If true prevents the widget or its child's geometry or layout information from being cached.  If this widget
changes every frame, but you want it to still be in an invalidation panel you should make it as volatile
instead of invalidating it every frame, which would prevent the invalidation panel from actually
ever caching anything.
Cursor: The cursor to show when the mouse is over the widget

methods.name: ForceLayoutPrepass
methods.doc:
Forces a pre-pass.  A pre-pass caches the desired size of the widget hierarchy owned by this widget.
One pre-pass already happens for every widget before Tick occurs.  You only need to perform another
pre-pass if you are adding child widgets this frame and want them to immediately be visible this frame.

methods.name: ForceVolatile
methods.doc: Sets the forced volatility of the widget.

methods.name: GetAccessibleSummaryText
GetAccessibleText
GetCachedGeometry
methods.doc:
Gets the last geometry used to Tick the widget.  This data may not exist yet if this call happens prior to
the widget having been ticked/painted, or it may be out of date, or a frame behind.

We recommend not to use this data unless there's no other way to solve your problem.  Normally in Slate we
try and handle these issues by making a dependent widget part of the hierarchy, as to avoid frame behind
or what are referred to as hysteresis problems, both caused by depending on geometry from the previous frame
being used to advise how to layout a dependent object the current frame.

methods.name: GetClipping
methods.doc: Gets the clipping state of this widget.

methods.name: GetDesiredSize
methods.doc:
Gets the widgets desired size.
NOTE: The underlying Slate widget must exist and be valid, also at least one pre-pass must
      have occurred before this value will be of any use.

@return The widget's desired size

methods.name: GetGameInstance
methods.doc:
Gets the game instance associated with this UI.
@return a pointer to the owning game instance

methods.name: GetIsEnabled
methods.doc: Gets the current enabled status of the widget

methods.name: GetOwningLocalPlayer
methods.doc:
Gets the local player associated with this UI.
@return The owning local player.

methods.name: GetOwningPlayer
methods.doc:
Gets the player controller associated with this UI.
@return The player controller that owns the UI.

methods.name: GetParent
methods.doc: Gets the parent widget

methods.name: GetRenderOpacity
methods.doc: Gets the current visibility of the widget.

methods.name: GetVisibility
methods.doc: Gets the current visibility of the widget.

methods.name: HasAnyUserFocus
methods.doc: Returns true if this widget is focused by any user.

methods.name: HasFocusedDescendants
methods.doc: Returns true if any descendant widget is focused by any user.

methods.name: HasKeyboardFocus
methods.doc:
Checks to see if this widget currently has the keyboard focus

@return  True if this widget has keyboard focus

methods.name: HasMouseCapture
methods.doc:
Checks to see if this widget is the current mouse captor
@return  True if this widget has captured the mouse

methods.name: HasMouseCaptureByUser
HasUserFocus
methods.doc: Returns true if this widget is focused by a specific user.

methods.name: HasUserFocusedDescendants
methods.doc: Returns true if any descendant widget is focused by a specific user.

methods.name: InvalidateLayoutAndVolatility
methods.doc:
Invalidates the widget from the view of a layout caching widget that may own this widget.
will force the owning widget to redraw and cache children on the next paint pass.

methods.name: IsHovered
methods.doc: Returns true if the widget is currently being hovered by a pointer device

methods.name: IsInViewport
methods.doc: @return true if the widget was added to the viewport using AddToViewport or AddToPlayerScreen.

methods.name: IsRendered
methods.doc: Returns true if the widget is Visible, HitTestInvisible or SelfHitTestInvisible and the Render Opacity is greater than 0.

methods.name: IsVisible
methods.doc: Returns true if the widget is Visible, HitTestInvisible or SelfHitTestInvisible.

methods.name: RemoveFromParent
methods.doc:
Removes the widget from its parent widget.  If this widget was added to the player's screen or the viewport
it will also be removed from those containers.

methods.name: ResetCursor
methods.doc: Resets the cursor to use on the widget, removing any customization for it.

methods.name: SetAllNavigationRules
SetClipping
methods.doc: Sets the clipping state of this widget.

methods.name: SetCursor
methods.doc: Sets the cursor to show over the widget.

methods.name: SetFocus
methods.doc: Sets the focus to this widget for the owning user

methods.name: SetIsEnabled
methods.doc: Sets the current enabled status of the widget

methods.name: SetKeyboardFocus
methods.doc: Sets the focus to this widget.

methods.name: SetNavigationRuleBase
SetNavigationRuleCustom
SetNavigationRuleCustomBoundary
SetNavigationRuleExplicit
SetRenderOpacity
methods.doc: Sets the visibility of the widget.

methods.name: SetToolTip
methods.doc: Sets a custom widget as the tooltip of the widget.

methods.name: SetToolTipText
methods.doc: Sets the tooltip text for the widget.

methods.name: SetUserFocus
methods.doc: Sets the focus to this widget for a specific user (if setting focus for the owning user, prefer SetFocus())

methods.name: SetVisibility
methods.doc: Sets the visibility of the widget.
